80m.day: Mostly NVIS (~100-300 km) due to strong D-layer absorption
80m.night: Good up to 1500+ km, but reduced from winter

40m.day: Limited range (~500 km) due to D-layer absorption

20m.day: Excellent worldwide propagation if solar flux adequate

10m.day: Open during solar maximum, sporadic-E in summer
10m.night: Usually closed except during high solar activity

20m.day: Excellent with slightly higher MUF than summer

10m.night: Rarely open, needs high solar activity

minimum.propagation: Poor upper HF (15m/10m), rely on 20m and below

maximum.propagation: Excellent HF propagation, 10m open daily for DX

declining.propagation: Good but declining, enjoy while it lasts

quiet.effects: Higher MUF, lower noise, better DX

storm.effects: HF blackout likely, enhanced VHF auroral
